config.question: Why did Henry George feel that the technologically advanced, modern society was flawed?

answer_3.response: Disturbed by an economic depression in the 1870s and by labor upheavals such as the great railroad strikes of 1877, George saw modern society—rich, complex, with material goods hitherto unknown—as sadly flawed: “The wealthy class is becoming more wealthy; but the poorer class is becoming more dependent. The gulf between the employed and the employer is growing wider; social contrasts are becoming sharper. . . .”
